column4: can someone tell me why my xorg.conf looks like this?  http://pastebin.ca/857448
I did, and with --phigh. I have also cleared the file totally, and reran both. same thing
does your monitor and mouse work?
it does, but not near as well as it has in the past
what do you mean? the monitor/mouse only work one way
I should be able to coifigure my xserver and I can't, save for the keyboard. I want to chance video drivers to see if I can fix the black window problem I have.
add the driver option to xorg
I think I have a bigger problem that that. I shouldn't need to do that ever, unless I have some unsupported video, right? I have Nvidia GeForce Go 6100
you never know what you should or shouldn't do... everything is conditional. Try installing nvidia-glx for that card
I know the linux installer for nvidia reconfigures xorg appropriately
check to see if adding driver "nvidia" helps
no good. instead of having unknown video with full 3d support, I have unknown fideo with only 2d support.
